p: For each SNP, we computed across samples the mean discordance D frac = mean | G imp − G 0|, and the mean bias B frac = mean ( G imp − G 0). The bias B frac is positive when the major allele is over-predicted and negative when the minor allele is over-predicted across all samples. The bias cannot exceed the discordance: | B frac|≤ D frac.
